projects.name: JacobAndes.dev
projects.description: This very website you're viewing right now!
projects.thoughts: I've rebuilt this site a few times, finally landing on using NextJS, as it's what I'm using most often in my day job. It's been fun learning more about Next and having a playground to break and try new things!

projects.name: import/from Web Development Blog
projects.description: My personal blog where I write about all things Front End-related
projects.thoughts: This is a fun, lightweight blog that reads my posts from Markdown files stored in the project repo! Originally built and then adapted from Maximillian Schwarzm√ºller's Next.js course.

projects.name: Bttn
projects.description: At Bttn I'm a Software Engineer II, working on internal tools and integrations, as well as maintaining the Storefront codebase.
projects.thoughts: Building the future of medical distribution at an early-stage startup. Every day is a new boundary pushed, something new learned, and another problem solved!

projects.name: PaintingJoy.art Front End
projects.description: Built for a local muralist and artist, this app is part portfolio, part e-commerce store, and part custom build admin CMS. This is the repo for the static React app.
projects.thoughts: This was a project that helped me realize the impact of scope creep, as well as pushed my boundaries in using images and building an admin CMS for customizability.

projects.name: PaintingJoy.art Back End
projects.description: Built for a local muralist and artist, this app is part portfolio, part e-commerce store, and part custom build admin CMS. This is the repo for the Express API.
projects.thoughts: This was a project that helped me realize the impact of scope creep, as well as pushed my boundaries in using images and building an admin CMS for customizability.

projects.name: SetPlaylist
projects.description: Find your favorite artist's setlists, and have them translated into a playlist, and added to your Spotify account!
projects.thoughts: This was my first Capstone project for Springboard bootcamp, and it was my first time building something connecting to outside API's, so it was a lot of fun to do it with Spotify with my love of music!
